p: Applying the 60/40 rule for determination of the predominant virus type, RSV-A was dominant in five seasons and RSV-B in four seasons with an alternating pattern every one or two seasons ( Table 1). No coincidence between RSV-type dominancy and the amplitude-like pattern timing in start and peak of the RSV epidemic period was observed ( Figures 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B).
